page.title: 14HOUSING
page.content:
There is quite a high proportion of modern housing in East Wellow. There are, however, a number of Victorian houses and notably, a number of cottages which date back to Tudor times, although they have been much restored.
Many of the houses are large with a high proportion having between three and five bedrooms. On the main road we found some smaller two bedroomed houses. There is one council estate on the main Romsey to Salisbury road. Otherwise the houses are privately owned with quite a few containing tenants who work as farm labourers.
Some of the older houses have thatched rooves. Most of these were in a good state of repair thanks to the efforts of the local thatcher.
